page.title: 14FARMS AROUND SANDHURST
page.content: PENNELLS & WILLINGTON COURT FARMS These are farmed as one unit by Mr Lyons. Beef cattle graze the lower meadows while beans, wheat and barley are grown on the slopes of Sandhurst Hill. The average Freisian/Hereford beef animal is sold for 500 pounds but it costs 300 pounds to rear. BENGROVE FARM Mr Warren has a Freisian dairy herd and also grows wheat on this 530 acre farm. One third of his fields flood in the winter every year. SINGLETON & MUSSEL END FARMS The Davis family run these together. They are so near the river that only one field does not flood of the 120 acres. Dairy cattle and sheep are kept and a few beef cattle are fattened. The farmers use Gloucester Market and local dairies to sell their products, though some beef cattle go further.
